text:
Triborough Bridge: The Manhattan Approach to same at the foot of East 125th Street, as viewed eastward from the 2nd Avenue "El" station. First Avenue runs across the view and connects with the Willis Avenue Bridge over the Harlem River. The latter structure is at the left and does not appear. The iron lattice work there and which apparently is same, is in actuality the Bronx Approach to the Triborough Bridge. The tenements in the foreground extend from 2nd Avenue to 1st Avenue.

June 7, 1940
Views 1,2

P. L. Sperr
title: Bridges - Triborough Bridge.
